item.title: STAT 385 Midterm Review
item.description: This semester in Stat 385: Statistics Programming Methods I have learned a fair amount of technical skills. Although I entered this class fairly experienced with R, I have learned quite a few R techniques that I was unfimiliar with previously, as well as learning how to use Github and R blogdown. R Functions and Techniques Listed below are a few functions that before entering this course I had either only used sparingly or hadn’t used at all.

item.title: About
item.description: Erlich administers the Hacker Hostel, a tech incubator where Richard, Big Head, Dinesh, and Gilfoyle live and work in exchange for 10 percent of their potential businesses. Erlich clings to his glory days, when he sold aviation start-up Aviato, a move that, at least in his mind, qualifies him to be a svengali lording over other tech nerds. He still drives a car emblazoned with multiple Aviato logos and smokes copious amounts of weed.

item.title: CodeRag
item.description: Notes: This article originally appeared in CodeRag. Code/Rag has always been more than just another online tech blog. We strive to be part of the tech community—serving an essential, fundamental look at what’s going on in the valley. It’s why our tagline is “Know Your Code.” We think a tech news publication should know the basics. Be the source. Get down to brass tacks. We can do that because we’re part of the very ecosystem we’re reporting on.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello! I’m Matthew Hoyle. I’m a Junior double majoring in Statistics and Astronomy at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Aside from my studies, I am also currently a course assistant for STAT 200: Statistical Analysis as well as a social media data analyst intern for the University of Illinois Student Money Management Center. Within my position at the Student Money Management Center, I have gained valuable experience cleaning, analyzing, and visualizing data from Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram, as well as creating automation programs for said processes.

item.title: Testy
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document.
